content.description: For a particular video game, Arianaâ€™s mean number of points earned per game is <math alttext="190" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>190</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Suppose that she plays <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> games in one evening, and her goal is to obtain a mean score of at least <math alttext="200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for the <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> games.
content.question: How many standard deviations above <math alttext="190" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>190</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is her goal?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
